content.user_title: Build Healthcare AI Models with PyHealth
content.value_statement: Developing machine learning models for healthcare requires understanding complex clinical data formats, medical coding systems, and specialized model architectures. This skill provides comprehensive guidance on using PyHealth to build, train, and evaluate clinical prediction models for mortality prediction, drug recommendation, and medical coding tasks.
actual_capabilities: Load and process healthcare datasets including MIMIC-III, MIMIC-IV, eICU, and OMOP formats
Define clinical prediction tasks such as mortality prediction, readmission, and drug recommendation
Implement 33+ models including RETAIN, SafeDrug, Transformer, and GNN architectures
Translate medical codes between ICD-9, ICD-10, NDC, RxNorm, and ATC systems
Preprocess sequential clinical events, physiological signals, and medical images
Train, evaluate, and calibrate models with clinical metrics and interpretability tools
limitations: Requires access to healthcare datasets which may have restricted availability due to HIPAA
Deep learning models require significant computational resources (GPU recommended)
Models trained on historical data may not generalize to current clinical practices
Does not provide actual patient data or pre-trained models (users must source their own)

prompt_templates.title: Load Healthcare Dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I load the MIMIC-IV dataset in PyHealth and set up a mortality prediction task? Show the code structure for data loading, task definition, and train/test splitting.

prompt_templates.title: Build Prediction Model
prompt_templates.prompt: What model should I use for hospital readmission prediction? I need interpretable results. Compare RETAIN, AdaCare, and Transformer models with code examples for each.

prompt_templates.title: Medical Code Translation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I translate ICD-9 diagnosis codes to ICD-10 and group them into CCS categories using PyHealth MedCode? Show how to handle one-to-many mappings.

prompt_templates.title: Train Clinical Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me the complete workflow for training a clinical prediction model: data loading, preprocessing with processors, model training with early stopping, evaluation with calibration, and attention-based interpretation for clinical explainability.

output_examples.input: Build a model to predict 30-day hospital readmission from patient history
output: Dataset: Load MIMIC-IV with patient visits and diagnoses
Task: Apply readmission_prediction_mimic4_fn for binary classification
Model: RETAIN for interpretable attention visualization
Preprocessing: SequenceProcessor with max_seq_length=50, post truncation
Training: Trainer with monitor='pr_auc_score' for imbalanced data
Evaluation: Calculate AUPRC, fairness metrics across demographics
Interpretation: Extract visit and feature attention weights for clinical review

best_practices: Always split data by patient rather than by visit to prevent data leakage across train/validation/test sets
Use AUPRC (Area Under Precision-Recall Curve) instead of AUROC for imbalanced clinical outcomes like mortality
Calibrate predictions using temperature scaling or Platt scaling before clinical deployment to ensure probability reliability
anti_patterns: Using random train/test splits instead of patient-level splits can cause data leakage and overly optimistic performance estimates
Evaluating only with accuracy on imbalanced clinical datasets masks poor performance on rare but critical outcomes
Deploying uncalibrated models without uncertainty quantification can lead to overconfident and potentially harmful clinical predictions

faq.question: Which datasets does PyHealth support?
faq.answer: PyHealth supports MIMIC-III, MIMIC-IV, eICU, OMOP for EHR data; SleepEDF, SHHS, ISRUC for sleep EEG; and COVID-19 chest X-ray datasets.

faq.question: What healthcare prediction tasks are available?
faq.answer: Over 20 tasks including mortality prediction, hospital readmission, length of stay, drug recommendation, sleep staging, seizure detection, and ICD coding.

faq.question: Can I integrate PyHealth with my existing PyTorch models?
faq.answer: Yes, PyHealth models inherit from BaseModel with standard PyTorch interfaces. You can use custom PyTorch models alongside PyHealth components.

faq.question: Is patient data safe when using PyHealth?
faq.answer: PyHealth is a processing library only. Users must ensure they have proper authorization and use de-identified data complying with HIPAA or GDPR regulations.

faq.question: Why is my model performing poorly on clinical data?
faq.answer: Check for class imbalance (use AUPRC), verify preprocessing normalization, ensure proper patient-level splitting, and validate data quality for missing codes.

faq.question: How does PyHealth compare to other healthcare ML libraries?
faq.answer: PyHealth offers an integrated pipeline from data loading through deployment with 33+ healthcare-specific models, standardized medical code translation, and clinical interpretability tools.
